48:00 Caption: We are seeing a great game so far, let's hope the players will be able to sustain their level of performance and keep entertaining the fans in such a fabulous way. The visitors dominated that half and looked more dangerous in attack. The tactic of the home side is slow build-up play and the away side is creating their opportunities using lightning-fast counter-attacks.

49:14 Caption: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
49:59 Caption: The players of both teams deserve praise from their managers and supporters for their performance on the pitch. If they carry on playing this exciting brand of football in future games, then the fans will surely be right behind them. Neither of the teams had any obvious superiority in this game. The tactic of the home side was slow build-up play and the away side was creating their opportunities using lightning-fast counter-attacks.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The match between Udinese and AC Milan was nothing short of thrilling, packed with dramatic goals, defining moments, and tactical brilliance. As the two teams took to the pitch, the anticipation among the fans was palpable, and the encounter lived up to the hype, delivering an enthralling spectacle of football.

From the very first whistle, it was Udinese who kicked off the proceedings. Within the opening seconds, both teams demonstrated their intent by vying for control of the ball. However, the tension quickly escalated, leading to the ball being out of play within the first minute. AC Milan was swift to clear their lines when needed, ensuring they maintained a solid defensive shape early on. 

As the game began to settle, Udinese earned a couple of throw-ins, testing Milan's defensive structure. Not long after, AC Milan committed a foul, providing Udinese with opportunities to make something of their set-pieces. The contest for midfield dominance was evident as players from both sides engaged in robust challenges, resulting in frequent interruptions. Despite Udinese's efforts, it was AC Milan who first found their rhythm.

In a brief moment of brilliance, AC Milan launched a counter-attack that culminated in their first goal. After a free-kick at the 4:51 mark, the ball was delivered into the box with precision. An effort on target was beautifully executed, catching the Udinese defence off guard and seeing the ball bulge into the back of the net. Milan's celebrations were justified, as this early goal set the tone for their determined display.

Udinese barely had moments to regroup before Milan struck again. At the 9:51 mark, another well-crafted offensive play saw the ball played into the box by Riccardo Montolivo. Giacomo Bonaventura was the man in the right place, slotting the ball past the goalkeeper and into the bottom right corner. With the score now 2-0 to Milan, Udinese faced an uphill battle to turn the game around.

The game continued with both teams exchanging fouls and free-kicks, adding to the intensity of the midfield battle. Balotelli, noted for his fiery temperament, received a yellow card after a particularly rash challenge, underscoring the physicality on display. Meanwhile, Udinese struggled to break down Milan's robust defensive lines, despite their best efforts to utilize set-piece situations.

As the half progressed, Udinese found themselves repeatedly thwarted by Milan's well-organized defence. There was a brief injury scare for Molla Wague, but he managed to shake it off and continued to press forward. Despite their possession, Udinese's attempts to create meaningful chances were met with resistance, and the first half seemed to be slipping away from them.

Milan exhibited their tactical acumen, launching swift counter-attacks whenever Udinese's defence left gaps. Udinese's frustrations began to show as another of their players, Ivan Rodrigo Piris, went into the referee’s book. Yet, Milan was not immune to bookings either, with the referee being kept busy addressing fouls and issuing yellow cards.

Just before the half-time whistle, Milan reinforced their dominance. At 45:38, a corner launched into the penalty area saw Cristian Zapata leap highest. His towering header found the net, making it 3-0 to Milan. It was a dagger to Udinese's hopes, but they were left with no choice but to regroup at half-time and plan a strategy for an unlikely comeback.

After a pulsating first half, the break provided some respite and an opportunity for tactical adjustments. Both sides made substitutions aimed at freshening up their options on the field. Udinese brought on Duvan Zapata, while Milan swapped Davide Calabria for Alex, signaling a slight tweak in their defensive lineup.

As the second half kicked off, Udinese appeared fired up and more determined. They pressed Milan aggressively and were rewarded for their efforts. Just over five minutes into the second period, Badu, assisted by Antonio Di Natale, found space inside the box and coolly slotted the ball into the bottom left corner, reducing the deficit to 1-3 and igniting hope among the home supporters.

Udinese kept pressing and, buoyed by their previous success, quickly grabbed another goal at the 12:07 mark. Cyril Thereau drove the ball across the penalty area to find Duvan Zapata, who had the simplest of tasks in tapping the ball into the empty net. This goal, bringing the score to 2-3, set up a tense and exhilarating final half-hour of the match.

Udinese's renewed vigor resulted in a flurry of attempts, corners, and set-pieces, keeping Milan’s defence on high alert. AC Milan responded by making another substitution, this time bringing on Andrea Poli for Keisuke Honda, hoping to bring stability to their midfield. 

The match, now fiercely contested, saw both teams indulging in fouls and drawing free-kicks. The referee's yellow card was frequently brandished, underscoring the intense physicality of the encounter. With the momentum tilting, Milan found themselves occasionally pinned back but managed to hold their defensive lines well.

As the game neared its climax, the pressure on both sides was immense. Udinese continued to pour forward, earning multiple corners and free-kicks. Edenilson and Antonio Di Natale were particularly active, constantly delivering crosses and causing havoc in Milan’s penalty area. However, Milan’s goalkeeper Diego Lopez stood resolute, repeatedly coming off his line to collect or intercept dangerous deliveries.

In the closing stages, Udinese brought on Marquinho for Manuel Iturra in a last-ditch attempt to inject fresh legs and creativity. Milan too made a substitution, with Luiz Adriano replacing Carlos Bacca, aiming to add dynamism to their attack and perhaps find a decisive goal to secure their victory.

The intensity peaked with dramatic moments in the dying minutes. A clear chance for Udinese saw a header just glide wide of the post, while a couple of efforts from corners were expertly saved or cleared by the vigilant Milan defence. The match saw one final twist as Bruno Fernandes of Udinese, having already been booked once, received a second yellow card for a reckless challenge and was subsequently sent off. This was a crushing blow to Udinese’s comeback hopes.

The referee's final whistle at the end of added time finally brought the curtain down on a captivating encounter. AC Milan emerged victorious with a 3-2 win, having shown clinical finishing and steadfast defending when it mattered most. Udinese, despite their valiant second-half performance, fell just short. Both teams, however, deserved applause for their commitment and the sheer entertainment they provided to the fans.

Reflecting on the match, it was clear that AC Milan's strategy of rapid counter-attacks differentiated them, while Udinese's approach of sustained possession and build-up play had its moments but ultimately fell just short. The match will be remembered for its thrilling goals, the tactical battles on the pitch, and the intense passion displayed by both sets of players. Such encounters are the essence of football, and fans will eagerly await the next chapter in this riveting series.
